Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\widgets\LinkPager

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\widgets\LinkPager » yii\base\Widget » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable, yii\base\ViewContextInterface
Available since version2.0
Source Code
LinkPager displays a list of hyperlinks that lead to different pages of target.

LinkPager works with a yii\data\Pagination object which specifies the totally number of pages and the current page number.

Note that LinkPager only generates the necessary HTML markups. In order for it to look like a real pager, you should provide some CSS styles for it. With the default configuration, LinkPager should look good using Twitter Bootstrap CSS framework.

Property Details

$pagination property
yii\data\Pagination $pagination = null

The pagination object that this pager is associated with. You must set this property in order to make LinkPager work.

$options property
array $options = ['class' => 'pagination']

HTML attributes for the pager container tag.

$firstPageCssClass property
string $firstPageCssClass = 'first'

The CSS class for the "first" page button.

$lastPageCssClass property
string $lastPageCssClass = 'last'

The CSS class for the "last" page button.

$prevPageCssClass property
string $prevPageCssClass = 'prev'

The CSS class for the "previous" page button.

$nextPageCssClass property
string $nextPageCssClass = 'next'

The CSS class for the "next" page button.

$activePageCssClass property
string $activePageCssClass = 'active'

The CSS class for the active (currently selected) page button.

$disabledPageCssClass property
string $disabledPageCssClass = 'disabled'

The CSS class for the disabled page buttons.

$maxButtonCount property
integer $maxButtonCount = 10

Maximum number of page buttons that can be displayed. Defaults to 10.

$nextPageLabel property
string $nextPageLabel = '»'

The label for the "next" page button. Note that this will NOT be HTML-encoded. If this property is null, the "next" page button will not be displayed.

$prevPageLabel property
string $prevPageLabel = '«'

The text label for the previous page button. Note that this will NOT be HTML-encoded. If this property is null, the "previous" page button will not be displayed.

$firstPageLabel property
string $firstPageLabel = null

The text label for the "first" page button. Note that this will NOT be HTML-encoded. If this property is null, the "first" page button will not be displayed.

$lastPageLabel property
string $lastPageLabel = null

The text label for the "last" page button. Note that this will NOT be HTML-encoded. If this property is null, the "last" page button will not be displayed.

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

string getId( $autoGenerate = true )
void setId( $value )

ID of the widget.

$view property
yii\web\View getView( )
void setView( $view )

the view object that can be used to render views or view files.

string getViewPath( )

the directory containing the view files for this widget.

Method Details

init() method
void init( )

Initializes the pager.

run() method
void run( )

Executes the widget.

This overrides the parent implementation by displaying the generated page buttons.

renderPageButtons() method
string renderPageButtons( )
return string the rendering result

Renders the page buttons.

renderPageButton() method
string renderPageButton( $label, $page, $class, $disabled, $active )
$label string The text label for the button
$page integer The page number
$class string The CSS class for the page button.
$disabled boolean Whether this page button is disabled
$active boolean Whether this page button is active
return string the rendering result

Renders a page button.

You may override this method to customize the generation of page buttons.

getPageRange() method
array getPageRange( )
return array the begin and end pages that need to be displayed.
